metadata.ttm:title: Delete SIN
metadata.ttm:desc: If you remove Products or Services from the Contract, you should also be sure to remove the SINs that correspond to those Products or Services. Note that Deletion Modifications fall under the category known as "Rapid Action Modifications." This means a Contractor can submit a Deletion Modification Request and the Contracting Officer can approve it without having to go through the Signature process.

div.p: Your contract should always reflect the most
up-to-date SINs.
On this screen, you can delete SIN(s) from your
GSA contract.
Select the date on which you would like to schedule
the termination of that SIN.
The actual termination date depends entirely on
the CO approving this modification.
For example, if you choose tomorrow as your
termination date, the SIN will not be deleted from
your schedule until the CO has had time to review and
approve the deletion.
Once the termination is in effect, you will no longer
be able to provide products or services
falling under that SIN category.
Note that the system will not allow you to terminate
all of the SINs associated with a particular contract
as doing so would eliminate your company's
ability to provide products or services to
the government.
If this is your goal, you should instead submit a
Cancel Contract modification.
When you have identified a termination date, check
the box under the "Action" column of the SIN or SINs
you would like to delete.
Deletion modifications fall under the category
known as "Rapid Action Modifications".
This means that a contractor can submit a
Deletion Modification request and the
Contracting Officer can approve it without having
to go through the signature process.
When you have finished click "Save and
Continue"
